newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore body offers Internet search engine.
newsitem.headline: Singapore body offers Internet search engine.

text.p: Singapore's Information Technology Institute (ITI) said on Monday it had launched three versions of its multilingual Internet search engine, iAgent.
ITI, the applied research and development arm of the National Computer Board, said iAgent Junior allows limited numbers of documents on a local host server to be indexed and searched.
It is able to index, retrieve and summarise documents in English, Chinese and Malay and create a profile of users' reading preferences.
Another version, iAgent Lite, lets users retrieve documents from selected remote hosts. It incorporates the SmartSpider technology which can target subsets of websites and newsgroups.
The third version, iAgent Pro, extends iAgent Lite to unlimited documents, database and users per site.
The three versions can be installed alongside web servers on Sun and AIX platforms and accessed by Internet browsers from all makes of computers, ITI said.
